item.title: Age-Groups Most Affected
item.description:
Breakdown of Ages Affected

As we can see in the graph below, the most affected group has been the Over 75s, while people aged in their early 20s or younger remain the least likely to have contracted the virus. The disproportionatly fewer young people being affected scews the mean somewhat; as we can see when it is adjusted to include only people 15 years old or older. Updated as of 5-Sep.

item.title: Covid-Progression-over-Time
item.description:
Progression of the Virus

As we can see here, the number of diagnosed Covid-19 cases in Ireland has grown exponentially, reaching 29672 on 5-Sep.Â On the brightside, however, we can see that the rate of infection has fallen drastically; as the impact of social distancing translates into each infected person infecting fewer and fewer other people.

item.title: Covid-related Hospitalisations
item.description:
Trend in Hospital Admissions

Hospital admissions have fallen slowly after early peaks near April 1st. The percentage increase on total hospital admissions trended downwards throughout the crisis.

item.title: Covid-related ICU Admissions
item.description:
Covid-Related ICU Admissions

The Intensive Care Units in Ireland saw peak patient influx in late March - early April, and from late April, the daily percentage increase in ICU admissions has dropped substantially (note: percentages below 0% relate to days where validation of data led to a decrease in the reported overall number of cases admitted to ICU).

item.title: Evolution-of-the-Mode-of-Transmission
item.description:
Evolution of the Mode of Transmission

As travel restricions came into place the primary mode of infection has moved away from travel to infected regions and it became far more common to catch the virus through close contact with an infected person, such as a family-member; or through Community Transmission.

Back to top

item.title: Hospitalisation by Age-Group
item.description:
Who has been hospitalised?

As we can see, those hospitalised have been predominantly in those age groups aged 65 years and over, while younger age groups remain unlikely to be hospitalised if infected. Updated as of 5-Sep.

## Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (position_stack).

item.title: Infection Rate By County
item.description:
Counties most affected

As we can see in the map, Dublin and Cavan have suffered the highest relative proportion of cases, followed by Monaghan, Westmeath, Kildare and Wicklow. As of 5-Sep , it is mainly counties of the west that have been least affected
